channel.title: UFC Unfiltered with Jim Norton and Matt Serra
channel.description: UFC Unfiltered with Jim Norton and Matt Serra is the must-listen podcast for fight fans. Edgy veteran comedian Jim Norton and former UFC welterweight champion Matt Serra push the boundaries in the UFC's first audio series. “Unfiltered” delivers everything, including pre- and post-fight analysis, industry stories, observations, opinions and interviews with UFC sources, fighters and celebrity fans.
channel.itunes:author: UFC

item.title: UF188: Daniel Cormier Sounds Off on Jon Jones, Conor McGregor, Dominick Cruz, and Stipe Miocic, and a UFC on FOX Glendale Recap
item.description: UFC Light Heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier calls in and talks to Matt and guest co-host Phoenix Carnevale about UFC on FOX Glendale, a new war of words with Jon Jones, fighting Stipe Miocic for the UFC Heavyweight title, coaching on The Ultimate Fighter: Undefeated, Conor McGregor's UFC 223 chaos, Dominick Cruz, Brock Lesnar, and more. Then, Matt and Phoenix break down all the action from Glendale, Arizona at UFC on FOX: Poirier vs. Gaethje. Plus, Matt receives a gift from an Unfiltered listener.

item.title: UF187: UFC on FOX: Poirier vs. Gaethje Preview
item.description: Jim and Matt break down this weekend's upcoming fights in Glendale, Arizona, and make their picks. Plus, the guys discuss Nick Diaz's potential return to the Octagon after resolving his issues with USADA, Eddie Alvarez saying he's Khabib Nurmagomedov's "Kryptonite", how Al Iaquinta was able to neutralize Khabib's ground-and-pound, whether Al helped show the blueprint to beating Khabib or not, and, for the first time ever, a double Matt's Movie Minute featuring Se7en and Ready Player One.

item.title: UF186: Recapping UFC 223, the Wildest Week in UFC History, with Chuck Zito In-Studio
item.description: Actor, stuntman, and former Hells Angel, Chuck Zito joins Jim and Matt in-studio to break down all the action from UFC 223, including Matt's full rundown from Al Iaquinta's corner against Khabib Nurmagomedov, Conor McGregor's chaotic stop in Brooklyn, and much more. Plus, the guys discuss Dana White's response to Showtime's Stephen Espinoza and a bunch of the recently announced fights from the UFC 25th Anniversary Press Conference.

item.title: UF185: Dana White Talks UFC 223 and Brian Ortega Joins In-Studio
item.description: UFC President Dana White joins the show and discusses UFC 223: Khabib vs. Holloway, Tony Ferguson's injury, Conor McGregor's status, Floyd Mayweather's potential future in the Octagon, DJ vs. TJ, The Diaz Brothers, Brock Lesnar, Mario Yamasaki, a UFC event in Russia, and much more. Plus, #1 UFC Featherweight Brian Ortega, and Ed Soares and James Luhrsen, join Jim and Matt in-studio to talk about Brian's title shot against Max Holloway, offering to step in to fight Khabib, becoming the first guy to finish Frankie Edgar, drowning while surfing, and more. And, to wrap up, the guys make their picks for UFC 223.

item.title: UF184: Khabib Nurmagomedov Joins In-Studio and Says "Aloha" to Max Holloway
item.description: Khabib "The Eagle" Nurmagomedov, and Ali Abdelaziz, join Jim and Matt in-studio ahead of Khabib's UFC 223 Lightweight title fight and discuss Max Holloway replacing Tony Ferguson, if any other fighters offered to step in, wanting to fight Georges St-Pierre, training at American Kickboxing Academy, Conor McGregor, Eddie Alvarez, wrestling a bear in Dagestan as a kid, and a lot more. Plus, the guys break down the series of events that led to Tony Ferguson's withdrawal, Darren Till vs. Wonderboy Thompson at UFC Fight Night Liverpool, Floyd Mayweather's continued MMA talk, and more.

item.title: UF183: Chris Gethard Taps Matt Serra (Kinda)
item.description: Comedian, actor, and writer, Chris Gethard, joins Jim and Matt in-studio for the whole show and bonds with Matt over comic books and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, and talks about getting started in comedy, The Chris Gethard Show, John Danaher, Renzo Gracie, falling in love with MMA through PRIDE, and much more. Plus, the guys break down Tony Ferguson vs. Kevin Lee after a fan tries to correct Matt on Instagram, Chris puts Matt in a rear-naked choke, and the biggest soda-spill in Unfiltered history goes down at the top of the show.

item.title: UF182: The Great Mark Henry Talks Frankie Edgar, Conor McGregor, and More
item.description: One of MMA's best coaches, Mark Henry, calls in and talks to Jim and Matt about Frankie Edgar's loss to Brian Ortega and bouncing back to fight Cub Swanson in Atlantic City, Conor McGregor, Khabib Nurmagomedov, how he comes up with his codes for striking combinations, Ali Abdelaziz, Zabit Magomedsharipov, Renzo Gracie stories, and a lot more. Plus, the guys discuss Dana White saying DJ vs. TJ is now not happening, Josh Barnett getting cleared by USADA, Sean O'Malley's foot surgery, and a bunch of recently announced fights.

item.title: UF181: Paul Felder Is Prepared for a Barnburner at UFC 223
item.description: Paul "The Irish Dragon" Felder calls in and talks about his potential Fight of the Night matchup with Al Iaquinta at UFC 223, the state of the UFC Lightweight division, looking to do color commentary when his fighting days are behind him, street fights growing up in Philadelphia, and more. Before that, Jim and Matt talk about Tony Ferguson vs. Khabib, Francis Ngannou calling for a fight against Brock Lesnar, and CM Punk's possible return. Plus, another installment of Matt's Movie Minute featuring Black Panther.

item.title: UF180: UFC Fight Night London Recap
item.description: Matt is back in-studio after returning from his travels with Dana White and Din Thomas filming Dana White: Lookin' For a Fight and breaks down UFC Fight Night London with Jim. Plus, the guys discuss a bunch of recently announced fights for UFC 224 and UFC 225, Floyd Mayweather continuing to talk about a potential MMA fight, Francis Ngannou responding to Derrick Lewis's repeated callouts, Cynthia Calvillo's NSAC suspension, and more.

item.title: UF179: Rose Namajunas Is on a Mission to Change the World, Matt Serra Gets His UFC Fight Night London Picks in from the Road, and Phoenix Carnevale Co-Hosts
item.description: UFC Women's Strawweight champion Rose Namajunas, and former UFC Heavyweight Pat Barry, call in from the road and discuss her upcoming first title defense in a rematch with Joanna Jedrzejczyk at UFC 223, becoming more comfortable as the champ, being on a mission to change the world as a true martial artist, knowing what Joanna's gameplan will be against her, how she spends her days off, and much more. Before that, Matt Serra also calls in from the road and gets his picks in for UFC Fight Night London. Plus, Jim and guest co-host Phoenix Carnevale talk about Ronda Rousey essentially announcing her retirement from MMA, Michael Bisping and Luke Rockhold going back-and-forth on Twitter, Khabib's comments about his fight with Tony Ferguson in Brooklyn on April 7, and more.

item.title: UF178: Amanda Nunes Is Excited About the Women's Bantamweight Division Again, Raquel Pennington Says It's Just Another Octagon in Brazil at UFC 224, and Bobby Kelly Co-Hosts
item.description: UFC Women's Bantamweight Champion Amanda Nunes calls in and discusses her upcoming title defense against Raquel Pennington at UFC 224, a possible matchup with Cris Cyborg, Ketlen Vieira emerging as a contender at 135, helping upcoming fighters in her new role with Invicta FC, and more. Later, #2 UFC Women's Bantamweight contender Raquel Pennington joins the show and discusses returning from a long layoff after badly breaking her leg during a hunting trip, being motivated to fight for the title in Amanda's home country, getting engaged to Tecia Torres, and more. Plus, Jim and guest co-host, comic Bobby Kelly talk about a potential trilogy fight between Luke Rockhold and Michael Bisping, Brock Lesnar's possible Octagon return, Jose Aldo calling out Jeremy Stephens, and Conor McGregor's back-and-forth with 50 Cent on Instagram.

item.title: UF177: Joseph Benavidez on His Year Away from the Octagon and an Impromptu Call from Din Thomas
item.description: #1 UFC Flyweight contender Joseph Benavidez calls in and talks to Jim and Matt about recovering from an ACL injury, training at the UFC Performance Institute, the state of the UFC Flyweight division, DJ vs. TJ, and more. Before that, friend of the show, Din Thomas, calls in and talks about the Hector Lombard-CB Dolloway fight, a possible Amanda Nunes vs. Cris Cyborg matchup, and Tyron Woodley's shoulder surgery. Plus, the guys break down Matt's TUF 4 fight vs. Pete Spratt, and shoot down one of Chris The Producer's segment ideas.

item.title: UF176: Brian Ortega Fights for the UFC Featherweight Title Next, and UFC 222 Recap
item.description: Newly-crowned number one UFC Featherweight contender Brian Ortega calls in and talks to Jim and Matt about his first round KO of Frankie Edgar at UFC 222, the importance of good sparring partners and a gym that looks out for his health, a late-night Nutella binge, the Brian Ortega Foundation, and potentially heading up to 155 after a fight against Max Holloway. Before that, the guys breakdown all the action from UFC 222, go over their picks, and listen to a potential new show open for Unfiltered.

item.title: UF175: Sean O'Malley Predicts a First Round KO, Mackenzie Dern Talks About Her UFC Debut, and Bobby Kelly Joins In-Studio
item.description: "Sugar" Sean O'Malley calls in for the first time and talks to Jim, Matt, and guest co-host, comic, Bobby Kelly, about why he started training martial arts to begin with, working with John Crouch and Benson Henderson at the MMA Lab, feeling no jitters on a bigger stage, meeting Snoop Dogg after winning a contract on Dana White's Tuesday Night Contender Series, and more. Later, Mackenzie Dern joins the show ahead of her highly anticipated UFC debut against Ashley Yoder and discusses Ashley as an opponent, her weightcut, and if there's added pressure headlining the UFC 222 FS1 Prelims. Plus, the guys review their picks from UFC On FOX Orlando and make their new picks for UFC 222.

item.title: UF174: Frankie Edgar, Brian Ortega, and Rafael Natal
item.description: Frankie "The Answer" Edgar, and Rafael Natal, join Matt and guest co-host Phoenix Carnevale in-studio to talk about Frankie's UFC 222 co-main event bout against Brian Ortega, the back-and-forth between Frankie's team and Conor McGregor, why he decided to fight instead of waiting for Max Holloway and a title shot, and much more. Later, Brian "T-City" Ortega calls in and talks about the opportunity to step in and fight Frankie, the fight as a wrestling vs. jiu-jitsu bout, earning a title shot with a win over Frankie, Stephens vs. Emmett, and more. Plus, another installment of Matt's Move Minute featuring The Last Jedi.
item.itunes:title: UF174: Frankie Edgar, Brian Ortega, and Rafael Natal

item.title: UF173: Mike Perry Feels Great Fighting at Home in Orlando, Jeremy Stephens Isn't Worried About Titles, Just Beating Guys Up, and UFC on FOX Preview and Picks
item.description: "Platinum" Mike Perry calls in ahead of his fight against Max Griffin this weekend at home in Orlando and discusses the long road to title contention, what he learned from the loss to Santiago Ponzinibbio, Jacare training at Fusion X-cel, and much more. Later, "Lil' Heathen" Jeremy Stephens joins the show and talks about his main event bout against Josh Emmett, taking advantage of opportunities when they arise, Frankie Edgar vs. Brian Ortega, why things are coming together for him in the Octagon, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt talk about Colby Covington and Derek Brunson going back-and-forth on Twitter, Conor McGregor's dubious new UFC record, Mark Diakiese's polite Sage Northcutt call out, and Vitor Belfort vs. Lyoto Machida. And, the guys make their UFC on FOX Orlando picks.

item.title: UF170: James Vick Loves Fighting In Texas, and UFC Fight Night Perth Recap
item.description: #12 UFC Lightweight James "The Texecutioner" Vick calls in ahead of his UFC Fight Night Austin bout against Francisco Trinaldo and discusses fighting at home in Texas, gi vs. no-gi jiu-jitsu, working as a bouncer in night clubs at the start of his MMA career, Tony Ferguson vs. Khabib Nurmagomedov, and hopefully cracking the top ten in the UFC Lightweight division with a big win in Austin. Plus, Jim and Matt break down all the action from this past weekend in Perth, Australia, review their picks, and talk about the reshuffling at the top of the UFC 222 card, Dana White's continuing criticism of Mario Yamasaki, Nate Diaz vs. Tyron Woodley, and more.

item.title: UF169: Rose Namajunas Talks Joanna Jedrzejczyk Rematch, and UFC 221 Preview and Picks
item.description: UFC Strawweight champion "Thug" Rose Namajunas calls in and talks to Jim and Matt about her title victory over Joanna Jedrzejczyk at UFC 217 in November, the upcoming UFC 223 rematch in April, her walkout song mixup, what she thinks Joanna's mindset will be going into the second fight, Karolina Kowalkiewicz's comments about Joanna's weightcutting issues, and more. Before that, Jim and Chris The Producer discuss Mario Yamasaki's statement regarding his performance at UFC Fight Night Belem, Nate Diaz and Dana White talking UFC 222, Michael Bisping's response to Lyoto Machida's callout, and more. Plus, the guys break down UFC 221 and make their picks.

item.title: UF168: Roy Jones, Jr. Discusses His Final Bout, and UFC Fight Night Belem Recap
item.description: Boxing legend Roy Jones, Jr. calls in to discuss his retirement bout vs. Scott Sigmon airing live and exclusively on UFC Fight Pass on February 8, his relationship with Dana White over the years, Anderson Silva, Floyd vs. Conor, GGG vs. Canelo 2, his Russian citizenship, his confrontation with Fat Joe, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt break down all the action from Belem, Brazil at UFC Fight Night: Machida vs. Anders, and talk about Max Holloway's leg injury forcing him out of UFC 222.

item.description: The baddest man on the planet, Stipe Miocic, calls in to talk about his record-breaking win over Francis Ngannou at UFC 220, his UFC 226 superfight against Daniel Cormier, coaching The Ultimate Fighter: Undefeated, and more. item.title: UF165: Laila Ali Sets the Record Straight on Ronda Rousey, and Derek Brunson Calls In
item.description: Undefeated women's boxing champion and author Laila Ali joins Jim and Matt in-studio to discuss her new cookbook, "Food For Life", her past comments about Ronda Rousey, Muhammad Ali, Cyborg reaching out to her for sparring, differences between women's boxing and women's MMA, and much more. Later, #8 UFC Middleweight contender Derek Brunson calls in from Charlotte to break down his rematch with Jacare Souza and talks about being a totally different fighter now, Romero vs. Rockhold, getting a BJJ Purple belt from David Branch, and more. Plus, the guys discuss Karolina Kowalkiewicz vs. Felice Herrig at UFC 223, CM Punk's Octagon return, and make their picks for UFC On FOX this weekend.

item.description: UFC Middleweight contender, and friend of the show, Uriah Hall, calls in to talk about the circumstances surrounding his withdrawal from his scheduled UFC Fight Night St. Louis bout against Vitor Belfort last Sunday, how he's feeling now, and what could be next for him. Plus, Jim and Matt break down all the action from UFC 220 and discuss Robert Whittaker's health issues, Tony vs. Khabib and Rose vs. Joanna in Brooklyn at UFC 223, and more.

item.title: UF163: Daniel Cormier, Stipe Miocic, EA Sports UFC 3, and UFC 220 Preview
item.description: First, UFC Light Heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier calls in to discuss his UFC 220 title defense against Volkan Oezdemir, Jon Jones's polygraph test, Cain Velasquez's return to AKA, Luke Rockhold training at Hard Knocks 365, the Young Bucks controversy, Khabib's dominant win over Edson Barboza, Stipe vs. Ngannou, and much more. Next, EA Sports UFC 3 Creative Director Brian Hayes joins the show to discuss developing the game, brand new game modes, and answers the question everyone wants to know: is Matt Serra in the game? Then, UFC Heavyweight champion Stipe Miocic calls in ahead of his potentially record-setting title fight against Francis Ngannou and discusses Francis as an opponent, and the hype behind him, being used to the underdog role, and more. Plus, the guys make their picks and preview UFC 220.

item.title: UF162: Jeremy Stephens, Kamaru Usman, and UFC Fight Night St. Louis Recap
item.description: "Lil Heathen" Jeremy Stephens calls in fresh off his KO of Dooho Choi at UFC Fight Night St. Louis and discusses the fight, wanting to fight Brian Ortega next, Holloway vs. Edgar, and getting back at Conor McGregor a year after the "who the fook is that guy?" press conference incident. Then, Kamaru Usman joins the show to talk about his dominant win over Emil Meek and clarify his post-fight interview remarks, what injuries he dealt with heading into the fight, feeling destined to fight Colby Covington, DC vs. Volkan Oezdemir, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt talk about Yoel Romero stepping in for the injured UFC Middleweight champion Robert Whittaker against Luke Rockhold in Perth at UFC 221, Dana White's update on Khabib vs. Tony Ferguson, and Conor McGregor possibly being stripped of the UFC Lightweight title. And, another installment of Matt's Movie Minute featuring "The Mist".

item.description: Former UFC Women's Bantamweight champion Holly Holm calls in to discuss her UFC 219 title fight against Cris Cyborg, being ready to shock the world again, Carlos Condit's return to the Octagon, Germaine de Randamie, and more. item.itunes:title: UF158: Holly Holm, Carlos Condit, and Kamp Kennedy
item.itunes:summary: Former UFC Women's Bantamweight champion Holly Holm calls in to discuss her UFC 219 title fight against Cris Cyborg, being ready to shock the world again, Carlos Condit's return to the Octagon, Germaine de Randamie, and more. Before that, "The Natural Born Killer" Carlos Condit joins the show and talks about returning to the UFC for the first time in over a year, Neil Magny as an opponent, evolving his training camps, and more. Plus, director Kamp Kennedy joins Matt in-studio to discuss the short film he directed, featuring Matt Serra, in support of the Netflix movie "Bright", and Matt and Chris The Producer make their UFC 219 picks.

item.title: UF157: Julian Marquez and 2018 Predictions
item.description: Julian "The Cuban Missile Crisis" Marquez calls in, following his successful UFC debut against Darren Stewart in Winnipeg, and discusses learning to love getting hit in the face, who he wants to fight next, Whittaker vs. Rockhold, how he got his nickname, being an adrenaline junkie, keeping his job at TopGolf, and more. Before that, the guys discuss Jorge Masvidal and Michael Bisping's back-and-forth on social media, Floyd Mayweather wanting into the UFC, and they make their predictions for who will be the champion of each division at this time next year. Plus, another installment of Matt's Movie Minute featuring The Last Jedi.

item.title: UF156: Josh Emmett and UFC On FOX 26 Recap
item.description: Josh Emmett, fresh off his upset KO of Ricardo Lamas at UFC On FOX: Lawler vs. dos Anjos, joins the show and discusses his big win on Saturday night, feeling like he was due for a finish, dealing with a short training camp and cutting weight, and wanting to fight Brian Ortega next. Plus, Jim and Matt break down the rest of the fights from UFC On FOX 26, recently announced fights, Conor McGregor's possible Octagon return, and more.

item.title: UF155: Robbie Lawler and Mike Perry
item.description: "Ruthless" Robbie Lawler calls in ahead of his UFC Welterweight title eliminator bout against Rafael dos Anjos this weekend on FOX and discusses RDA as an opponent, training at Hard Knocks 365, Matt Hughes's road to recovery, GSP, Ponzinibbio vs. Perry, his motivation to continue fighting, and more. Later, Mike Perry joins the show and talks about Santiago Ponzinibbio as an opponent, finding the balance between skill and aggression, Lawler vs. RDA, and more. Plus, Matt and guest co-host Jamie Crowder break down UFC On FOX: Lawler vs. dos Anjos, Stipe vs. Ngannou, and answer a fan question about BJJ.

item.title: UF154: Jon Anik and UFC Fight Night Fresno Recap
item.description: Lead UFC commentator Jon Anik joins the show to discuss a variety of topics including UFC On FOX: Lawler vs. dos Anjos, UFC Fight Night Fresno, GSP, Whittaker vs. Rockhold, Stipe vs. Ngannou in his hometown of Boston, working with Joe Rogan, and the proper pronunciation of "Miocic". Before that, Matt Serra calls in and breaks down all the action from Fresno this past weekend.

item.title: UF153: Cub Swanson and Brian Ortega
item.description: Both UFC Fight Night Fresno main event fighters, Cub Swanson and Brian Ortega, join the show today. First, Brian calls in to talk about Cub Swanson as an opponent, earning his stripes in the UFC Featherweight division, and having a near-death experience while surfing in February. Then, "Killer" Cub calls in and talks about Brian Ortega as an opponent, Aldo vs. Holloway, whether he's in a "gatekeeper" role or not, what he wants in his next UFC contract, and more. Plus, the guys discuss DC vs. Volkan Oezdemir, early betting lines for a hypothetical Stipe Miocic vs. Francis Ngannou fight, and Jim, Matt, and Chris The Producer make their picks for this coming weekend's fights.

item.title: UF152: Paul Felder and UFC 218 Recap
item.description: UFC Lightweight contender Paul "The Irish Dragon" Felder joins the show to discuss his UFC 218 TKO of Charles Oliveira, wanting the validation of being a ranked UFC fighter, Alvarez vs. Gaethje, working with Duke Roufus, growing up acting, Philly as a fighting city, and much more. Plus, Jim and Matt break down all the action from Detroit at UFC 218 this past weekend.

item.title: UF151: Max Holloway and Justin Gaethje
item.description: UFC Featherweight champion Max "Blessed" Holloway calls in to talk about his UFC 218 rematch with Jose Aldo, dealing with Frankie Edgar dropping out due to injury, preparing to be the greatest of all time, Overeem vs. Ngannou, and staying warm away from Hawaii. Later, Justin Gaethje joins the show and discusses what he believes Eddie Alvarez's strategy will be against him in Detroit, loving to show off inside the Octagon, Rose Namajunas's UFC 217 title win, and more. Plus, Jim, Matt, and Chris The Producer make their UFC 218 picks, and discuss Conor McGregor's fighting future and recent outside-the-Octagon issues.

item.title: UF150: Alistair Overeem, Michelle Waterson, and UFC Fight Night Shanghai Recap
item.description: #1 UFC Heavyweight Alistair Overeem joins Jim and Matt in-studio and talks about his upcoming UFC 218 fight against rising star Francis Ngannou, past fights with Mirko Cro Cop, Badr Hari, and Brock Lesnar, what Jon Jones is up to, and much more. Before that, "The Karate Hottie", Michelle Waterson, calls in and discusses her bout with Tecia Torres at UFC 218, wanting a rematch with Rose Namajunas, rebounding from losses, and more. Plus, the guys break down the action from Shanghai this past weekend.

item.title: UF149: Mackenzie Dern and UFC Fight Night Shanghai Preview
item.description: BJJ world champion and MMA fighter Mackenzie Dern calls in to discuss her Invicta FC 26 fight against Kaline Medeiros, growing up learning jiu-jitsu from her father, "Megaton" Dias, why she wanted to transition from jiu-jitsu competitions to MMA, fighting as a Strawweight rather than a Flyweight, and more. Later, Chris The Producah pitches new segment ideas to the guys, Jim and Matt give updates on the Volkan Oezdemir and Colby Covington situations, and preview UFC Fight Night Shanghai.

item.title: UF148: Din Thomas and UFC Fight Night Sydney Recap
item.description: American Top Team coach and former UFC fighter, Din Thomas, joins Jim and Matt in-studio for the whole show to discuss a variety of topics including UFC Fight Night Sydney, Colby Covington's run-in with Fabricio Werdum, Volkan Oezdemir's legal issues, Cyborg vs. Holly Holm, Tyron Woodley's potential fight against Nate Diaz, Nik Lentz, Dana White: Lookin' For a Fight, and much more.

item.title: UF147: James Vick and Bobby Kelly
item.description: James "The Texecutioner" Vick, fresh off his UFC 217 victory over Joe Duffy, calls in and discusses the win, wanting to fight Justin Gaethje next, weightcutting, a possible move to Welterweight, and more. Before that, Matt Serra joins the show and gives his thoughts on the Conor McGregor situation, Bisping vs. Gastelum, Oscar De La Hoya, and some recently announced fights. Plus, Jim and guest co-host Bobby Kelly talk about Anthony Pettis's fractured rib, Dominick Cruz's injury, and more.

item.title: UF146: Sage Northcutt, Aleks Paunovic, and Bobby Kelly
item.description: Actor and big UFC fan, Aleks Paunovic, joins Jim and guest co-host Bobby Kelly in-studio to talk about UFC 217, boxing vs. MMA, working on War for the Planet of the Apes, and much more. Later, UFC Fight Night Norfolk winner "Super" Sage Northcutt calls in to discuss his first fight back inside the Octagon after a little less than a year away, training full time at Team Alpha Male, auditioning to be Ivan Drago's son in Creed 2, and more. Plus, Matt Serra joins the show from his family vacation in Disney World to give his thoughts on this past weekend's fights.

item.title: UF145: Dustin Poirier, Matt Brown, and Jamey Jasta
item.description: #8 UFC Lightweight contender Dustin Poirier calls in to discuss his headlining fight against Anthony Pettis in Norfolk, Virginia, wanting the winner of Justin Gaethje vs. Eddie Alvarez, Colby Covington, Airbnb, and more. Later, Matt "The Immortal" Brown joins the show to talk about his possible retirement fight against Diego Sanchez, creating his own training equipment, Ketogenic diets, walkout music, and more. Plus, Jim and guest co-host Jamey Jasta discuss UFC 217, a potential Wonderboy vs. Darren Till fight, the pros and cons of new weightclasses, and Joe Rogan's comments about Jon Jones.

item.title: UF144: Everlast and UFC 217 Recap
item.description: Everlast from House of Pain joins Jim and Matt in-studio to break down every fight from one of the best cards in history, UFC 217. Plus, the guys talk with Everlast about how he got into UFC, being rushed to a Russian hospital in the middle of nowhere, meeting Chuck Liddell, and much more.

item.title: UF143: Chris Weidman, Jeff Novitzky, and Din Thomas
item.description: Former UFC Middleweight champion Chris Weidman and UFC Vice President of Athlete Health and Performance Jeff Novitzky join Matt and guest co-host Phoenix Carnevale in-studio to discuss a variety of topics including USADA testing, tainted supplements, marijuana, male enhancement pills, Jon Jones, Lance Armstrong, Cortney Casey, UFC 217, and much, much more. Before that, Din Thomas calls in to discuss Ricardo Liborio's departure from American Top Team, Colby Covington, and the new episode of Dana White: Lookin' For a Fight. Plus, the group makes their UFC 217 title fight picks.

item.title: UF142: Cody Garbrandt
item.description: UFC Bantamweight champion Cody Garbrandt calls in ahead of his UFC 217 bout against TJ Dillashaw and discusses TJ as an opponent, what treatments he's undergone to correct his back injury, Michael Bisping, wanting Mighty Mouse next, expecting his first child, and more. Plus, Matt Serra calls in after taking a sick day and talks to Jim about this past weekend's fights from Sao Paulo, Brazil.

item.title: UF141: Lyoto Machida, Andrew Jenks, and Duke Roufus
item.description: Documentary filmmaker and host of the What Really Happened? podcast, Andrew Jenks, joins Jim and Matt in studio to discuss his new show, making a documentary about Anthony Pettis back in the day, why MMA is the most under appreciated sport, and much more. Then, Roufusport owner and head coach, Duke Roufus, calls in and talks about being a big film buff, CM Punk's fighting future, Sergio Pettis vs. Henry Cejudo, Demian Maia, Tyron Woodley, and more. Finally, former UFC Light Heavyweight champion Lyoto Machida joins the show and discusses his long absence from the Octagon, Derek Brunson as an opponent, and making another run at a UFC title.
item.itunes:title: UF141: Lyoto Machida, Andrew Jenks, and Duke Roufus
item.itunes:summary: Documentary filmmaker and host of the What Really Happened? podcast, Andrew Jenks, joins Jim and Matt in studio to discuss his new show, making a documentary about Anthony Pettis back in the day, why MMA is the most under appreciated sport, and much more. Then, Roufusport owner and head coach, Duke Roufus, calls in and talks about being a big film buff, CM Punk's fighting future, Sergio Pettis vs. Henry Cejudo, Demian Maia, Tyron Woodley, and more. Finally, former UFC Light Heavyweight champion Lyoto Machida joins the show and discusses his long absence from the Octagon, Derek Brunson as an opponent, and making another run at a UFC title.

item.title: UF135: Mickey Gall and Derrick Lewis
item.description: Rising UFC Welterweight Mickey Gall joins Jim and Matt in-studio for the whole show to discuss his UFC 217 fight against Randy Brown at home at Madison Square Garden, Kevin Lee, Mike Perry, USADA testing, bar fights, working with a new dietician, and much more. Later, "The Black Beast" Derrick Lewis joins the show and talks about fighting Fabricio Werdum this coming weekend at UFC 216, learning from his loss to Mark Hunt, his Instagram page, and more. Plus, the guys talk about the recently announced UFC Featherweight title bout between Max Holloway and Frankie Edgar at UFC 218 and they preview UFC 216.

item.title: UF134: Demetrious Johnson and Kevin Lee
item.description: UFC Pound-For-Pound king Demetrious Johnson calls in to talk about his rescheduled UFC Flyweight title bout with Ray Borg at UFC 216, how he's going to finish Borg and in how many rounds, potentially setting the all-time UFC consecutive title defense record, Henry Cejudo, Sergio Pettis, and more. Before that, #7 UFC Lightweight Kevin Lee joins the show to talk about fighting Tony Ferguson for the interim UFC Lightweight title, handling newfound popularity, and looking at UFC 216 as the biggest fight of his life. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Alistair Overeem vs. Francis Ngannou, Dominick Cruz vs. Jimmie Rivera, Cynthia Calvillo vs. Carla Esparza, and Matt interviews "Tony Ferguson" at the end of the show.

item.title: UF131: Mike Perry and Chrissy Blair
item.description: Rising UFC Welterweight contender "Platinum" Mike Perry calls in to talk about his second straight KO win at UFC Fight Night Pittsburgh, calling out Robbie Lawler, Woodley vs. Maia, having a ground game no one's seen yet, getting closer to God through training, and much more. Before that, Octagon girl Chrissy Blair joins the show to talk about some of her favorite fights, Joanna vs. Rose, and her company, Kalumi Health. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Carlos Condit's potential Octagon return, Edmond Tarverdyan's comments about Ronda Rousey fighting Cris Cyborg, Valentina Shevchenko's possible move to the UFC Women's Flyweight division, and the guys work on a new sign off for the podcast.

item.title: UF129: Luke Rockhold
item.description: Returning to the Octagon for the first time in over a year, #3 UFC Middleweight Luke Rockhold calls in ahead of his UFC Fight Night Pittsburgh bout against David Branch and talks about Branch as an opponent, dealing with his title loss to Michael Bisping, GSP getting a shot at the UFC Middleweight title, his first full training camp away from AKA in Florida with Henri Hooft, and much more. Before that, Jim and Matt discuss Joanna vs. Rose, Mickey Gall vs. Randy Brown, Cowboy Cerrone vs. Darren Till, the results of Jon Jones's B sample, Fabricio Werdum's comments about USADA being too strict, and Yair Rodriguez's potential move to Team Alpha Male. Plus, Jim talks about an exciting new superhero.

item.title: UF127: Demetrious Johnson and Tyson Pedro
item.description: The only Flyweight champion in UFC history, Demetrious Johnson, calls in to talk about his possibly record-setting UFC 215 title fight against Ray Borg, a potential move to Bantamweight, Jon Jones and the Pound-For-Pound rankings, whether or not his nickname is staying the same, and more. Before that, #13 UFC Light Heavyweight contender Tyson Pedro joins the show to discuss his fight against Ilir Latifi, being named after Mike Tyson, learning martial arts from his father, rugby injuries, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt recap UFC Fight Night Rotterdam and preview UFC 215.

item.title: UF126: Rickson Gracie, Renzo Gracie, and Amanda Nunes
item.description: Two members of the legendary Gracie family join the show as Renzo Gracie sits in with Jim and Matt and Rickson Gracie calls in to discuss The Rickson Gracie Cup, receiving his red belt in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, his fights against Zulu and Yoji Anjo, why Royce Gracie joined the UFC instead of him, competing in the Vale Tudo Open in Japan, BJJ as a social tool, not a fighting tool, and so much more. Plus, UFC Women's Bantamweight champion Amanda Nunes calls in to talk about her UFC 215 fight against Valentina Shevchenko, why she had to withdraw from their first scheduled rematch at UFC 213, and how she's handling her health issues going forward.

item.title: UF125: Michael Che, Justin Gaethje, and Nicco Montano
item.description: Comic and Saturday Night Live Weekend Update co-anchor Michael Che joins Matt and guest co-host Jamie Crowder in-studio to talk Mayweather vs. McGregor, getting on SNL, and the art of stand up comedy. Then, Justin Gaethje calls in to talk about coaching on Season 26 of The Ultimate Fighter, his electrifying Octagon debut against Michael Johnson, Ferguson vs. Lee for the interim UFC Lightweight title, and more. Finally, TUF 26 competitor Nicco Montano talks to the guys about the experience in the TUF house, training at FIT NHB in Albuquerque, her Native American heritage, and a lot more. Plus, Matt and Jamie discuss some recently announced fights.

item.description: Newly signed UFC Middleweight Charles Byrd calls in to talk about earning a UFC contract after going 2-0 on Dana White's Tuesday Night Contender Series, Muhammad Ali as his personal hero, the UFC Middleweight division, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt break down the entire Jon Jones situation, Conor vs. Floyd, Brian Stann's departure from the UFC, and more.

item.title: UF122: Kevin Lee
item.description: #7 UFC Lightweight Kevin Lee calls in to talk about his interim UFC Lightweight title fight against Tony Ferguson at UFC 216, the controversial end to his fight with Michael Chiesa in OKC, Conor McGregor being a "paper champion", deciding to just be himself, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt talk about Junior Dos Santos getting flagged by USADA, options for Francis Ngannou, Chris Weidman's potential move to Light Heavyweight, and a slew of recently announced fights like Fabricio Werdum vs. Derrick Lewis and Matt Brown vs. Diego Sanchez.

item.title: UF121: David Branch
item.description: #9 UFC Middleweight contender David Branch joins Jim and Matt in-studio to talk about his September 16 fight against Luke Rockhold in Pittsburgh, training BJJ with Renzo Gracie and John Danaher, growing up in the Bronx, Bisping vs. GSP, MayMac, and much, much more. Plus, the guys discuss Tony Ferguson vs. Kevin Lee for the interim UFC Lightweight title, Aljamain Sterling and Cody Garbrandt going back-and-forth on Twitter, and Matt Hughes's road to recovery.

item.title: UF119: Urijah Faber and Aljamain Sterling
item.description: Rising UFC Bantamweight contender Aljamain Sterling joins Jim and Matt in-studio to discuss his big win over Renan Barao at UFC 214, having fun inside the Octagon now, and wanting a fight with Jimmie Rivera next. Before that, UFC Hall of Famer Urijah Faber calls in and talks about retirement from fighting, the SnoopCast on Dana White's Tuesday Night Contender Series, Cody Garbrandt's health status, DJ vs. TJ, and more.

item.title: UF117: Rashad Evans and Sergio Pettis
item.description: Former UFC Light Heavyweight champion "Suga" Rashad Evans calls in to discuss his fight against Sam Alvey, dealing with fight day nerves, Jon Jones, and acclimating to the environment in Mexico City. Later, Sergio Pettis joins the show to talk about his first main event fight against Brandon Moreno, falling in love with the process of martial arts, a possible title shot, CM Punk, and a lot more. Plus, Jim and Matt break down the UFC Fight Night: Pettis vs. Moreno card, DC's first public statement since losing the title, what could be next for Jon Jones, and Matt got a gift from a fan on the subway.

item.title: UF116: UFC 214 Recap
item.description: Jim and Matt break down every fight from UFC 214 and discuss Jon Jones regaining his UFC Light Heavyweight title, Jon calling out Brock post-fight, Joe Rogan's apology to DC, Tyron Woodley vs. Demian Maia, Dana White reversing course on Bisping vs. GSP, Cyborg's win over Tonya Evinger, Aljamain Sterling's great performance, and much, much more.

item.title: UF115: Tyron Woodley, Tonya Evinger, and Phoenix Carnevale
item.description: UFC Welterweight champion Tyron Woodley calls in ahead of his UFC 214 title defense against Demian Maia and discusses Demian as an opponent, new weightcutting protocols in Califorinia, Lawler vs. Cowboy, and more. Before that, debuting UFC Women's Featherweight fighter Tonya Evinger joins the show to talk about fighting Cyborg for the vacant belt, how her experience will help her in the fight, Germaine de Randamie, and always feeling like an underdog. Plus, Matt and guest co-host Phoenix Carnevale talk about Chris Weidman and Michael Bisping going back and forth on social media, the full UFC 214 lineup, and a Matt's Movie Minute on Spider-Man: Homecoming.

item.title: UF114: Daniel Cormier and Jon Jones
item.description: Less than a week away from their highly anticipated and long-awaited rematch at UFC 214, UFC Light Heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and #1 Light Heavyweight contender Jon Jones call in to talk to Jim and Matt. First, DC discusses the freedom he feels now being himself and not worrying about how people feel about him, the high-level wrestling he's doing during this training camp, going at it with Jon on social media, the letdown in fights following title bouts, and much more. Later, Bones Jones discusses the idea of Octagon rust, appreciating what Conor McGregor has done for the sport of mixed martial arts, and growing as a person. Plus, Jim and Matt break down Chris Weidman's big win and the rest of the UFC On FOX Long Island card, recently announced fights, and much more.

item.title: UF113: Kelvin Gastelum, Sen Dog, and Billy Graziadei
item.description: #8 UFC Middleweight Kelvin Gastelum calls in ahead of his UFC On FOX main event fight against former champion Chris Weidman and talks about Weidman as an opponent, easily making weight now, finding a home at Kings MMA, wanting a rematch with Tyron Woodley, and more. Later, Sen Dog from Cypress Hill and Billy Gradziadei from Biohazard join Jim and Matt in-studio to discuss their new supergroup Powerflo, Floyd vs. Conor, Matt training Billy in jiu-jitsu back in the day, and more. Plus, the guys break down UFC Fight Night Glasgow, Woodley vs. Maia, Eddie Alvarez and Justin Gaethje as coaches for TUF 26, and DC and Jon Jones going back and forth on social media.

item.title: UF112: Chris Weidman, Jessie Graff, and Phoenix Carnevale
item.description: American Ninja Warrior and stuntwoman Jessie Graff joins Matt and guest co-host Phoenix Carnevale in-studio to talk about competing on the show, training for stunts, and wanting to be the female Jackie Chan. Later, former UFC Middleweight champion Chris Weidman calls in to discuss his main event fight against Kelvin Gastelum, getting over his controversial loss to Gegard Mousasi, the interim UFC Middleweight title fight between Robert Whittaker and Yoel Romero, and what it's like training with Matt Serra. Plus, Matt and Phoenix talk about the MayMac press conferences and the action from over the weekend in Glasgow, Scotland.

item.title: UF111: Justin Buchholz and Dan Soder
item.description: Team Alpha Male head coach Justin Buchholz calls in from Scotland to talk about Cynthia Calvillo's UFC Fight Night Glasgow bout against Joanne Calderwood, Floyd vs. Conor, Cody Garbrandt's potential return from injury, Darren Elkins vs. Dennis Bermudez, CFR therapy, and much more. Plus, comic and actor Dan Soder joins Jim and Matt in-studio to talk about his new half hour special on Netflix as part of "The Standups". And, the guys talk about Fabricio Werdum appealing his UFC 213 loss to Alistair Overeem, the first MayMac presser, and Jim gives Matt a great new nickname.

item.title: UF110: Duke Roufus, Din Thomas, and International Fight Week Recap
item.description: Roufusport head coach Duke Roufus calls in to talk about everything from Anthony Pettis's big win at UFC 213 and Tyron Woodley's strategy against Demian Maia, to Conor McGregor vs. Floyd Mayweather and his own missed chance to fight Ken Shamrock, and much, much more. Later, Din Thomas joins the show to discuss Amanda Nunes's withdrawal from her UFC 213 title bout against Valentina Shevchenko. And, Jim and Matt break down all the fights from the TUF: Redemption Finale and UFC 213.

item.title: UF109: Amanda Nunes
item.description: Reigning UFC Women's Bantamweight champion, Amanda Nunes joins Jim and Matt for a candid discussion about her upcoming title defense against Valentina Shevchenko. Nunes, who will be attempting to successfully defend her title for the 3rd time talks about her preparation for this fight, what the last year has been like for her as a champion and how she plans to keep her success going. Amanda also talks about the incident that happened when she faced off with Shevchenko at their press conference.

item.title: UF108: Felice Herrig and Justin Gaethje
item.description: Felice Herrig calls in following her big win over Justine Kish at UFC Fight Night Oklahoma City and discusses the fight, her emotional post-fight press conference, wanting a rematch with Paige VanZant, and much, much more. Later, debuting, undefeated Lightweight Justin Gaethje joins the show to talk about his TUF 25 Finale fight against Michael Johnson, bringing his leg kicks to the UFC, training with Rose Namajunas, how he matches up with Conor McGregor, and whether leaving WSOF was a hard decision, or not. Plus, Jim and guest co-host Luis J. Gomez talk about Tonya Evinger replacing Megan Anderson against Cyborg at UFC 214, Khabib's possible return and Tony Ferguson's response, and Conor vs. Floyd.

item.title: UF106: Michael Chiesa, Shawn Wayans, and Phoenix Carnevale
item.description: Actor, producer, writer, and comedian Shawn Wayans joins Matt and guest co-host Phoenix Carnevale in studio to talk about everything from his film career, In Living Color, and the writing process, to what drives him to do standup comedy and his thoughts on Conor vs. Floyd. Later, #7 UFC Lightweight contender Michael Chiesa calls in to discuss his return to the Octagon after more than a year away, Kevin Lee as an opponent and their press conference run-in awhile back, Tony Ferguson, Conor McGregor, and watching his first UFC fight on VHS. Plus, Matt and Phoenix talk about Germaine de Randamie's first statement since having the UFC Women's Featherweight title removed, John Makdessi stepping in to fight Sage Northcutt at UFC 214, Wonderboy and Gamebred angling to fight each other, and much more.

item.title: UF105: Johny Hendricks and UFC Fight Night Singapore Recap
item.description: Former UFC Welterweight champion Johny Hendricks calls in to talk about his UFC Fight Night: Chiesa vs. Lee co-main event bout against Tim Boetsch, feeling great going through another camp as a Middleweight, CSAC's new weightclasses, and fighting back home in Oklahoma for the first time in ten years. Plus, Jim and Matt break down the fights from Singapore over the weekend, and discuss Matt Hughes's condition, the unfortunate passing of former UFC fighter Tim Hague, Conor vs. Floyd officially being booked, and Germaine de Randamie being removed as UFC Women's Featherweight champion.

item.title: UF102: Max Holloway and Brian Kelleher
item.description: The undisputed UFC Featherweight champion, Max "Blessed" Holloway calls in following his UFC 212 win over Jose Aldo and discusses how the fight went down, who could be next in line, win streaks, DJ vs. TJ, and finally getting his Acai berry shake. Before that, Brian "Boom" Kelleher joins the show to talk about his big win in Brazil over Iuri Alcantara, finding out he was getting a shot in the UFC, possibly fighting on Long Island on July 22, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt talk about Derrick Lewis vs. Mark Hunt, the continuing Mighty Mouse vs. TJ Dillashaw situation, Miesha Tate's comments on Cyborg and Angela Magana, "War Machine" getting a possible life sentence, and NYSAC amending its weigh-in protocols.

item.title: UF96: Uriah Hall and Amanda Nunes
item.description: #12 UFC Middleweight Uriah Hall joins Jim and Matt in studio to discuss what's next for him inside the Octagon, switching from a "want" to a "must" mentality before getting on The Ultimate Fighter, growing up in Jamaica, Chris Weidman vs. Kelvin Gastelum, and much more. Also, UFC Women's Bantamweight champion Amanda Nunes calls in and talks about her UFC 213 rematch with Valentina Shevchenko, how things have changed for her since the Ronda Rousey fight, and whether she wants to go up to Featherweight or not. Plus, the guys talk about UFC 211, Demian Maia's Welterweight title shot, and Matt's Movie Minute returns.

item.title: UF95: Kevin Lee, John Morrison, and UFC 211 Recap
item.description: #12 UFC Lightweight Kevin Lee calls in to talk about his altercation with Michael Chiesa at the UFC Summer Kickoff press conference over the weekend, fighting Chiesa at UFC Fight Night: Chiesa vs. Lee on June 25, training at Xtreme Couture in Las Vegas, Eddie Alvarez vs. Dustin Poirier, and more. Later, Lucha Underground wrestler and actor John Morrison calls in to discuss his new movie, "Boone: The Bounty Hunter", training parkour, and whether or not he would fight in MMA. item.title: UF94: Frankie Edgar, Eddie Alvarez, and Frank Grillo
item.description: Actor Frank Grillo joins Jim and Matt in studio to discuss Season 3 of Kingdom, training with Rickson Gracie, Conor vs. Floyd, Matt Hughes, proper diet, and more. Then, former UFC Lightweight champion Eddie Alvarez calls in to talk about getting over his loss to Conor McGregor, feeling liberated by that KO, his UFC 211 fight with Dustin Poirier, and teaching his kids about social media. Also, #2 UFC Featherweight Frankie Edgar joins the show to talk about fighting rising star Yair Rodriguez, the possibility of a title fight next, BJ Penn vs. Dennis Siver, and more. Plus, the guys break down UFC 211, 2017's biggest fight card, so far.

item.title: UF93: Stipe Miocic
item.description: UFC Heavyweight champion Stipe Miocic calls in ahead of his rematch with Junior Dos Santos at UFC 211 and discusses the pressures of a title defense, being frugal, MMA vs. boxing, and more. Plus, Jim hosts the show solo and talks to Chris The Producer about the Canelo vs. Chavez, Jr. fight, Conor McGregor becoming a father, Dana's response to Anderson Silva, the Diaz Brothers's fighting future, Demian Maia responding to Tyron Woodley, GSP telling Bisping to pick a date to fight, Francis Ngannou moving to Las Vegas, and more.

item.title: UF92: Cody Garbrandt and Dustin Poirier
item.description: UFC Bantamweight champion, #5 UFC Pound-For-Pound fighter, and TUF 25 coach, Cody Garbrandt calls in to talk about his experience around the TUF house, Team Alpha Male saving his life, his upcoming first title defense against TJ Dillashaw at UFC 213 in July, the infamous TJ knockout video, getting engaged, and more. Later, #9 UFC Lightweight Dustin Poirier calls in to talk about his UFC 211 FX prelims Main Event fight against Eddie Alvarez, anticipating the best version of Eddie on May 13, recovering from a shin injury after the Jim Miller fight at UFC 208, and remaining calm and focused during fights. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Anderson Silva's recent comments, Cub Swanson's broken hand, a possible Cris Cyborg vs. Megan Anderson fight, and Matt talks about awarding a Black belt to one of his students.
item.itunes:title: UF92: Cody Garbrandt and Dustin Poirier
item.itunes:summary: UFC Bantamweight champion, #5 UFC Pound-For-Pound fighter, and TUF 25 coach, Cody Garbrandt calls in to talk about his experience around the TUF house, Team Alpha Male saving his life, his upcoming first title defense against TJ Dillashaw at UFC 213 in July, the infamous TJ knockout video, getting engaged, and more. Later, #9 UFC Lightweight Dustin Poirier calls in to talk about his UFC 211 FX prelims Main Event fight against Eddie Alvarez, anticipating the best version of Eddie on May 13, recovering from a shin injury after the Jim Miller fight at UFC 208, and remaining calm and focused during fights. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Anderson Silva's recent comments, Cub Swanson's broken hand, a possible Cris Cyborg vs. Megan Anderson fight, and Matt talks about awarding a Black belt to one of his students.

item.title: UF91: Mike Perry, Tyron Woodley, and Din Thomas
item.description: UFC Welterweight fighter Mike Perry calls in off the heels of his highlight reel KO of Jake Ellenberger at UFC Fight Night Nashville and discusses that fight, his Twitter beef with Al Iaquinta, what he learned from his loss to Alan Jouban, his face tattoos, and more. Later, UFC Welterweight champion Tyron Woodley joins for an impromptu conversation about his potential next opponent in July, not wanting to fight Wonderboy anymore, Maia vs. Masvidal, and long days on set filming a TV show. Plus, ATT coach Din Thomas joins Jim and Matt in studio to talk about run-ins with drunks while filming Dana White: Lookin' For A Fight, Floyd vs. Conor, and more.

item.title: UF90: Justin Buchholz and Joe Stevenson
item.description: Team Alpha Male Head Coach Justin Buchholz calls in to talk about The Ultimate Fighter: Redemption, whether there's a tape of Cody KOing TJ or not, Duane Bang's relationship with the Alpha Males, Cynthia Calvillo, and much more. Later, Joe "Daddy" Stevenson calls in to talk about being back in the TUF house fourteen years after winning Season 2, battling alcoholism over the course of his career, BJ Penn's fight against Dennis Siver, and keyboard warriors. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Michael Bisping's thoughts on who the number one contender should be after GSP, Rumble Johnson's comments following UFC Fight Night Nashville, and a quick breakdown of UFC 211 on May 13.

item.title: UF89: TJ Dillashaw and Eddie Gordon
item.description: #2 UFC Bantamweight and #13 UFC Pound-For-Pound contender TJ Dillashaw calls in to talk about coaching on TUF 25, the bad blood with Team Alpha Male, Cody Garbrandt's KO video claims, the Cody vs. Cruz title fight, and more. Later, Eddie "Truck" Gordon joins the show to talk to Jim and Matt about being inside The Ultimate Fighter house for a second time, battling his weight earlier in his career, and getting into MMA after running into Chris Weidman. Plus, the guys talk about UFC Fight Night: Swanson vs. Lobov, Edson Barboza wanting a rematch with Tony Ferguson, Frank Mir's two-year suspension, and Ronda Rousey and Travis Browne getting engaged.

item.title: UF88: John Dodson and Al Iaquinta
item.description: John "The Magician" Dodson calls in ahead of his UFC Fight Night Nashville fight against Eddie Wineland to talk about treating every day like it's special, being recruited by Jackson-Wink MMA at a Chuck E. Cheese's, loving video games, Jon Jones, Mighty Mouse, Cody vs. TJ, and more. Later, "Raging" Al Iaquinta joins the show to talk about fighting Diego Sanchez in the Co-Main Event of UFC Fight Night: Swanson vs. Lobov, sightseeing and enjoying traveling solo, and the UFC 211 matchup between Jorge Masvidal and Demian Maia. Plus, Jim and Matt break down CSAC's potential MMA weightcutting reforms, DC and Jimi Manuwa going back and forth on Twitter, and a lot more.

item.title: UF87: Cub Swanson and Eddie Wineland
item.description: #4 UFC Featherweight contender Cub Swanson calls in to talk about his upcoming fight against Artem Lobov, Mighty Mouse as the Pound-For-Pound king, how the fight game has changed over time, and his unusual upbringing. Later, #10 UFC Bantamweight Eddie Wineland talks to the guys about fighting John Dodson, being a full-time firefighter, broken jaws, and keeping stingrays as pets. Plus, Jim and Matt break down UFC Fight Night: Johnson vs. Reis, Jacare's new UFC contract, recently announced fights, and more.

item.title: UF86: Demetrious Johnson and Robert Whittaker
item.description: #1 UFC Pound-For-Pound fighter and Flyweight champion Demetrious "Mighty Mouse" Johnson calls in ahead of his potential tenth straight title defense against Wilson Reis and discusses Wilson as an opponent, the possibility of a superfight with Cody Garbrandt, staying motivated, video games, and more. Before that, Middleweight contender Robert Whittaker calls in to talk about fighting Jacare Souza, dealing with Jacare's high level jiu-jitsu, GSP's return to the Octagon, and the state of the UFC Middleweight division, in general. Plus, Jim and Matt talk about Kelvin Gastelum being pulled from his UFC 212 fight with Anderson Silva, possible replacement opponents for The Spider, Urijah Faber going into the 2017 UFC Hall of Fame, Dana's comments about Conor vs. Floyd, and a lot more.

item.title: UF85: Rose Namajunas and Michelle Waterson
item.description: #4 UFC Women's Strawweight contender Rose Namajunas joins Jim and Matt in studio to talk about her upcoming fight against Michelle Waterson, dealing with her loss to Karolina Kowalkiewicz, having a purpose inside the Octagon, and she addresses Joanna Jedrzejczyk's recent comments about her, amongst other things. Later, Rose's opponent, #6 Strawweight Michelle Waterson calls in and discusses exercising her demons through MMA, how she got the nickname "Karate Hottie", Joanna picking her to beat Rose, and she clears the air with Matt about a joke from years ago. Plus, the guys discuss UFC 210 and the controversial Chris Weidman vs. Gegard Mousasi fight.

item.title: UF84: Daniel Cormier and Myles Jury
item.description: UFC Light Heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier calls in to discuss his UFC 210 rematch with Anthony "Rumble" Johnson, his decision to fight Anderson Silva at UFC 200, what it is about him that fans dislike, and much more. Before that, UFC Featherweight Myles Jury talks to Jim and Matt about his FS1 prelims main event fight against Mike De La Torre, why he hasn't fought since December 2015, adding new skills to his arsenal after back-to-back losses, and Aldo vs. Holloway. Plus, the guys talk about Cyborg dropping the Invicta FC Women's Featherweight title and a possible matchup with Germaine de Randamie, Khabib's first comments about withdrawing from the Tony Ferguson fight, Jorge Masvidal vs. Demian Maia, Robbie Lawler vs. Cowboy Cerrone, the UFC's first event on Long Island, and Matt shows Jim some jiu-jitsu techniques.

item.title: UF83: Doug Benson and Don Frye
item.description: Comedian Doug Benson joins in studio to talk about his new Comedy Central show, "The High Court", superhero movies, hosts a contest between Jim and Matt, and more. Later, UFC Hall of Famer Don Frye calls in to talk PRIDE Never Die! week on UFC Fight Pass, overcoming his recent health issues, and gaining perspective from his near-death experience. Plus, Jim talks about getting tricked on April Fool's Day, and the guys discuss Michael Chiesa vs. Kevin Lee, Tim Boetsch vs. Johny Hendricks, and much more.

item.title: UF82: Katlyn Chookagian and Grandmaster Flash
item.description: UFC Women's Bantamweight fighter Katlyn Chookagian joins Jim and Matt in studio to talk about her UFC 210 fight against Irene Aldana, what it's like training with guys like Frankie Edgar and Edson Barboza, bouncing back from her first UFC loss, the possibility of taking Jim to his first jiu-jitsu class, and much more. Then, hip-hop icon Grandmaster Flash joins the guys in studio to discuss his Netflix show "The Get Down: Part 2", Conor vs. Floyd, and being in on the ground floor of hip-hop.

item.title: UF81: Cynthia Calvillo, Chad Gilbert, and Bobby Kelly
item.description: New Found Glory guitarist Chad Gilbert joins Jim and guest cohost Bobby Kelly in studio to discuss training Muay Thai, BJ Penn vs. Dennis Siver, Bisping vs. GSP, DC vs. Rumble 2, New Found Glory's brand of pop-punk, and a lot more. Later, UFC Women's Strawweight Cynthia Calvillo calls in to talk about how her debut fight against Amanda Cooper came to be, her fight against Pearl Gonzalez at UFC 210 on April 8 in Buffalo, New York, Cody vs. TJ, PVZ's future training in Sacramento, the Strawweight division in general, and more. Plus, Jim and Bobby discuss Luke Rockhold's callout of Fabricio Werdum and Tony Ferguson's call for Conor McGregor to defend or vacate the UFC Lightweight title.

item.title: UF80: Kelvin Gastelum and Bobby Kelly
item.description: #8 UFC Middleweight contender Kelvin Gastelum calls in to talk about his UFC 212 fight against Anderson Silva in Rio de Janeiro on June 3, competing at Welterweight and Middleweight, working with Eddie Bravo at 10th Planet Jiu-Jitsu, and much more. Before that, Jim, Matt, and guest cohost Bobby Kelly discuss John Kavanagh's suggestion that Gunnar Nelson fight Wonderboy next, the UFC 210 poster, possible next opponents for Francis Ngannou, and Matt talks about his new favorite pizza parlor.

item.title: UF79: Brad Pickett and UFC Fight Night: London Recap
item.description: Longtime UFC contender Brad Pickett calls in following his final fight inside the Octagon and discusses his fight against Marlon Vera, the awesome response from fans on his retirement, what might be next for him, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt break down the great fights from UFC Fight Night: Manuwa vs. Anderson and talk about Matt Hughes's potential MMA return, Dana's comments on the Diaz Brothers and Conor vs. Floyd, and what gets them emotional and makes them cry.

item.title: UF78: Ice Cube, Alan Jouban, and Phoenix Carnevale
item.description: Rapper, actor, and producer Ice Cube joins in-studio to discuss his new show "VH1 Hip Hop Squares", his BIG3 basketball league, and picking the right roles. Then, Alan Jouban calls in to talk to Matt and guest host Phoenix Carnevale about his UFC Fight Night 107 fight against Gunnar Nelson, staying stress free and taking in the moment before a fight, working with Eddie Bravo, his thoughts on the UFC Welterweight division, and more.

item.description: UFC Hall Of Famer Forrest Griffin joins Matt and guest co-host Ray Longo to discuss UFC Fight Night 106: Belfort vs. Gastelum, the UFC Performance Institute, hard sparring, training at different gyms, and much more. Before that, Matt and Ray talk about recently announced fights like Bisping vs. GSP, the stacked UFC 211 card, and more.

item.title: UF76: Francis Ngannou
item.description: #6 UFC Heavyweight and rising star Francis Ngannou joins Jim and Matt in studio to discuss his dream of becoming a UFC champion, his life in Cameroon, being homeless in Paris, wanting to fight Cain Velasquez next, and the desire to become a complete fighter. First, the guys preview UFC Fight Night 106: Belfort vs. Gastelum, possible next matchups for Tony Ferguson, Michael Bisping's comments on Woodley vs. Thompson 2, recently announced fights, and the results of the World MMA Awards 2017.

item.title: UF75: Georges St-Pierre and UFC 209 Recap
item.description: Former longtime UFC Welterweight champion Georges St-Pierre calls in to discuss a variety of topics including his return to the Octagon against Michael Bisping for the UFC Middleweight title, the dangers of weightcutting, his fights against Matt Serra, Johny Hendricks at 185, ring rust, a superfight against Anderson Silva, Woodley vs. Thompson 2, and much more. Plus, Jim and Matt break down UFC 209: Woodley vs. Thompson 2, and they give their review of Logan during a new installment of Matt's Movie Minute.

item.title: UF74: Khabib Nurmagomedov and Al Iaquinta
item.description: #1 UFC Lightweight Khabib Nurmagomedov calls in ahead of his UFC 209 fight against Tony Ferguson and discusses dealing with Tony's guard, training with Renzo Gracie, and not caring about Conor McGregor's whereabouts. Before that, UFC Lightweight contender Al Iaquinta joins Jim and Matt in studio to talk about his UFC Fight Night 108 bout against Diego Sanchez, teaching seminars in Australia, and where his "Raging" nickname came from. Plus, the guys make their UFC 209 picks and talk about Michael Bisping vs. GSP for the UFC Middleweight title, NYSAC denying Holly Holm's UFC 208 appeal, Dan Hardy's possible return to the Octagon, and more.

item.title: UF73: Stephen "Wonderboy" Thompson
item.description: Stephen "Wonderboy" Thompson joins Jim and Matt in studio for the whole show to talk about his rematch with Tyron Woodley for the Welterweight title at UFC 209, a potential matchup with GSP, weightcutting, learning from losing to Matt Brown, Royce Gracie vs. Kimo, comic books, and much more.

item.title: UF72: Dale Earnhardt, Jr. and Lando Vannata
item.description: NASCAR driver Dale Earnhardt, Jr. calls in at the top of the show to discuss returning to racing at the Daytona 500, mentally getting over his dad's death, dealing with concussion issues, and the thrill of experiencing his first UFC live event in March at UFC 196. Then, up and coming Lightweight contender Lando Vannata joins the show to talk about his UFC 209 fight against David Teymur, his stunning wheel kick KO of John Makdessi, his UFC debut against Tony Ferguson, Khabib Nurmagomedov, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt try out their new catchphrases and the Serra family makes a special appearance at the end of the show.

item.title: UF71: Michael Bisping and Harley Flanagan
item.description: UFC Middleweight champion Michael Bisping calls in to discuss who his next opponent might be, Anderson Silva vs. Derek Brunson, why he dislikes Hector Lombard, and how his knee is healing up after surgery. Plus, hardcore music legend and Renzo Gracie black belt Harley Flanagan joins Jim and Matt in studio to talk about his life in music and jiu-jitsu. And, the guys discuss all things UFC Fight Night Halifax.

item.title: UF70: Fat Joe and Travis Browne
item.description: Rapper Fat Joe joins Jim and Matt in studio to talk about everything from his new album Plata O Plomo and being friends with Renzo Gracie to performing at the favelas in Brazil and being a huge Conor McGregor fan. Before that, #9 UFC Heavyweight Travis Browne calls in to talk about his fight against Derrick Lewis, the unfair criticism of Edmond Tarverdyan, the differences between Jackson-Wink and Glendale Fighting Club, and dislocating his finger against Fabricio Werdum. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Brock Lesnar's retirement, a possible Conor vs. Mayweather fight, Germaine de Randamie calling for a rematch with Holly Holm, and new potential ABC rules for instant replays and loss of bodily function.

item.title: UF69: Derrick Lewis and Johny Hendricks
item.description: #8 UFC Heavyweight Derrick Lewis calls in ahead of his UFC Fight Night Halifax main event fight against Travis Browne and discusses training with George Foreman in his early days, why he was disappointed with his performance against Shamil Abdurakhimov, and his thoughts on UFC 208. Then, Johny Hendricks joins the show to talk about his Middleweight debut against Hector Lombard, enjoying training again without having to cut to 170lbs, and dealing with Twitter criticisms. Plus, Jim and Matt break down all the action from UFC 208: Holm vs. de Randamie.

item.title: UF68: Theo Rossi and Yves Edwards
item.description: Actor and producer Theo Rossi and retired UFC fighter Yves Edwards join Matt in studio on today's episode. First, Yves and Matt discuss fighting each other back in the day, how they became friends, Renzo Gracie, Yves training with Dustin Poirier for his UFC 208 fight against Jim Miller, and more. Then, Theo joins the show and talks about his experiences on Sons Of Anarachy and Luke Cage, training with Royce Gracie in his garage, the Empire State Run Up, fighters handling losing well, Stipe vs. JDS 2, Cain Velasquez, Cody Garbrandt, and so much more.

item.title: UF67: Anderson Silva and Wyclef Jean
item.description: Musician and producer Wyclef Jean joins Jim and guest co-host Dan Soder in studio to discuss being an MMA fan from the beginning, training jiu-jitsu, Conor vs. Mayweather, meeting Barack Obama, his musical inspirations, and more. Later, the great Anderson Silva calls in to talk about fighting Derek Brunson in Brooklyn, wanting to fight Michael Bisping, and more. Plus, Jim and Dan discuss UFC Fight Night: Bermudez vs. Korean Zombie results, Ryan Bader's UFC exit and the possibility of a Mighty Mouse vs. Cody Garbrandt superfight.

item.title: UF66: Alexa Grasso and Ovince Saint Preux
item.description: Undefeated UFC Women's Strawweight contender Alexa Grasso calls in ahead of her UFC Fight Night 104 co-main event fight against Felice Herrig and talks about how she got started in MMA, what she expects against Felice, and staying loose dancing to Taylor Swift on fight days. Then, #6 UFC Light Heavyweight Ovince Saint Preux talks to Jim and Matt about aspirations of being in law enforcement growing up, learning from the Jon Jones fight, staying mentally strong after a couple of losses in a row, Cormier vs. Rumble 2, and more. Plus, the guys discuss Gegard Mousasi's concerns about the federal travel ban, Dominick Cruz shutting down Raphael Assuncao's callout, Ian McCall losing yet another opponent, and Matt's Movie Minute on True Romance.

item.title: UF65: Dana White and Dennis Bermudez
item.description: UFC President Dana White joins the show to discuss Ronda Rousey's fighting future, the possibility of Nunes vs. Shevchenko 2, Francis Ngannou, Jorge Masvidal, Weidman vs. Mousasi, Nick Diaz turning down a fight with Robbie Lawler, what's next for JDS, the Women's Featherweight division, his Super Bowl weekend plans, and much, much more. Before that, UFC Featherweight fighter Dennis Bermudez calls in to discuss his upcoming fight with The Korean Zombie, fighting zombies in Deer Park, cooking, and what he'd do to get on Dana White: Lookin' For A Fight. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss the results of UFC on Fox 23, and almost get to a Matt's Movie Minute.

item.title: UF64: Julianna Pena
item.description: #2 UFC Women's Bantamweight contender Julianna Pena calls in ahead of her fight against Valentina Shevchenko and doesn't hold back while discussing Valentina as an opponent, getting a title shot against Amanda Nunes, Ronda Rousey's NDAs, Holly Holm's skills, and much more. Plus, Jim and Matt talk about the cancelled JDS vs. Stefan Struve fight, Derrick Lewis vs. Travis Browne becoming the main event at UFC Fight Night Halifax, Johny Hendricks's upcoming Middleweight debut against Hector Lombard, Tony Ferguson blasting Conor McGregor for never defending a title, and more.

item.title: UF63: Valentina Shevchenko and Jorge Masvidal
item.description: Welterweight contender Jorge "Gamebred" Masvidal calls in to talk about his UFC on FOX 23 fight against Cowboy Cerrone, wanting to hurt Cowboy for stealing his opponents, street fights in Miami, his relationship with the late great Kimbo Slice, MMA judging, and more. Later, #1 UFC Women's Bantamweight Valentina Shevchenko calls in to discuss Julianna Pena as an opponent, getting a title shot with a win, and being a lifelong martial artist. Plus, Jim and Matt talk about the recently announced Chris Weidman vs. Gegard Mousasi fight, Cody Garbrandt's hit list, Travis Browne leaving Glendale Fighting Club, and a brand new installment of Matt's Movie Minute.

item.title: UF62: Tyron Woodley and Wonderboy Thompson
item.description: UFC Welterweight champion Tyron Woodley calls in ahead of his rematch with Wonderboy Thompson on March 4 at UFC 209 and talks about how the first fight went, particularly the scoring of the fourth round, managing his energy, and he asks Matt what he did wrong with the guillotine attempt in the fourth round, as well. Later, title challenger Stephen Thompson calls in and discusses wanting to come into the rematch bigger than the first fight, feeling like he had an off night at UFC 205, Tyron being noncommittal about a rematch, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Amanda Nunes calling for the winner of Holly Holm vs. Germaine de Randamie, Cody Garbrandt and TJ Dillashaw coaching TUF 25, Khabib vs. Ferguson, RDA's move to Welterweight, and Gegard Mousasi's frustrations about booking a fight.

Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Amanda Nunes calling for the winner of Holly Holm vs. Germaine de Randamie, Cody Garbrandt and TJ Dillashaw coaching TUF 25, Khabib vs. Ferguson, RDA's move to Welterweight, and Gegard Mousasi's frustrations about booking a fight.
item.itunes:keywords: Holly Holm,tj dillashaw,the ultimate fighter,tyron woodley,Matt Serra,Amanda Nunes,Cody Garbrandt,UFC 205,Wonderboy Thompson,UFC 209,UFC Unfiltered,ufc podcast,Jim Norton,mma,ufc fight night,UFC

item.title: UF60: John Moraga
item.description: #8 Ranked UFC Flyweight John Moraga joins UFC Unfiltered to preview this weekend's upcoming bout with #15 ranked UFC Flyweight Sergio Pettis in Arizona at UFC Fight Night 103. The guys take a look at Dana White's rebuttal to actress Meryl Streep's comments on the sport of Mixed Martial Arts, Ronda Rousey's cryptic social media post and the twitter war of words between Tyron Woodley and Stephen "Wonderboy" Thompson. All that and more in this episode of UFC Unfiltered with Jim Norton and Matt Serra.

item.title: UF59: Nina Ansaroff and Court McGee
item.description: UFC Strawweight division fighter Nina Ansaroff and Welterweight fighter Court McGee are this week's guests on UFC Unfiltered with Matt and Jim. Ansaroff, who is the girlfriend of current UFC bantamweight champion Amanda Nunes, joins the guys to talk about her upcoming fight at UFC Fight Night 103 and the aftermath of Amanda's win over Ronda Rousey. McGee, who will be taking on Ben Saunders during the same promotion talks about his life before fighting, respecting his opponents and how he has been clean and sober for years. Matt and Jim also give their take on Meryl Streep's speech at The Golden Globes where she mentioned the sport of Mixed Martial Arts is not art at all. All that and more in this episode of UFC Unfiltered with Jim and Matt.

item.title: UF58: Cody Garbrandt and Amanda Nunes
item.description: UFC Bantamweight champions Cody Garbrandt and Amanda Nunes both call in to discuss their UFC 207 title fights on today's episode. First, Amanda talks about her first title defense against Ronda Rousey, Edmond Tarverdyan as a coach, her beef with Cat Zingano, training with her girlfriend Nina Ansaroff for her upcoming fight, and more. Then, Cody Garbrandt joins the guys to talk about executing his gameplan against Domnick Cruz, enjoying putting a five round beating on him, a potential matchup with TJ Dillashaw, and coughing up a balloon.

item.title: UF57: Din Thomas and UFC 207 Recap
item.description: Jim and Matt break down the incredible UFC 207 card, discussing Amanda Nunes's first title defense over Ronda Rousey, Cody Garbrandt's championship performance against Dominick Cruz, Johny Hendricks's continuing weight issues, the Tim Means vs. Cowboy Oliveira no contest, and a lot more. Later, Din Thomas calls in to talk about the new episode of Dana White: Lookin' For A Fight, working with Amanda leading up to the Ronda fight, Edmond Tarverdyan as a coach, Tyron Woodley vs. Michael Bisping rumors, and more.

item.title: UF56: Bas Rutten, TJ Dillashaw, and Phoenix Carnevale
item.description: MMA Legend Bas Rutten calls in to discuss his Pancrase days, the evolution of MMA, Amanda Nunes vs. Ronda Rousey, being a certified culinary chef, and much more. Before that, #1 UFC Bantamweight contender TJ Dillashaw joins the show to talk about his UFC 207 fight against John Lineker, training with Duane Bang, a possible rematch with Dominick Cruz, Urijah Faber's retirement, and feeling like he's the real 135 champ. Plus, Matt and guest host Phoenix Carnevale talk UFC 207, comic books, and more.

item.title: UF55: G-Eazy, Amanda Nunes, and Ray Longo
item.description: UFC Women's Bantamweight champion Amanda Nunes calls in ahead of her first title defense against Ronda Rousey at UFC 207 and talks about her motivation, defending the armbar, and more. Later, rapper G-Eazy calls in to discuss creating the UFC 207 theme song, "Vengeance On My Mind", Johnny Cash as a personal hero, and chasing greatness. Plus, Ray Longo joins Matt in studio to talk about Cris Cyborg's USADA test failure, Conor McGregor in the Pound-For-Pound conversation, and a possible Khabib Nurmagomedov vs. Tony Ferguson matchup.

item.title: UF54: Johny Hendricks and Tim Means
item.description: Former Welterweight champion Johny Hendricks joins the show to discuss his UFC 207 bout against Neil Magny, running through the motions in the past and being fired up again going into this fight, weight cutting issues, and a possible trilogy fight with Robbie Lawler. Later, Tim Means calls in to talk about his UFC Fight Pass main event bout against Cowboy Oliveira on December 30, his USADA test failure, his experiences in prison, mixed martial arts saving his life, and being in a good place now in his personal life and his career. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss upcoming fights, bullet ants and bee stings, and Jimmy debates whether to take a kickboxing class or not.

item.title: UF50: Cowboy Cerrone and Matt Brown
item.description: Cowboy Cerrone calls in to address Dana White's UF49 comments about him and his involvement in the MMAAA, his thoughts on Bjorn Rebney, fighting Matt Brown at UFC 206, and shooting guns while riding a horse. Later, Matt Brown joins the show to talk about fighting Cowboy on Saturday, USADA and PEDs, his UFC 198 run-in with his former coach, metal music, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Cris Cyborg's statement on why she turned down two Women's Featherweight title fights, the controversial Gray Maynard vs. Ryan Hall fight at the TUF 24 Finale, and a lot more.

item.title: UF49: Dana White, Max Holloway, and Anthony Pettis
item.description: UFC President Dana White calls in to discuss a wide range of topics including the newly announced MMA Athletes Association, Conor McGregor fighting Floyd Mayweather, Cris Cyborg turning down two Women's Featherweight title fights, Jon Jones, Khabib Nurmagomedov, Tim Elliott, Ronda's return, and much more. Later, Max Holloway calls in to talk about his interim Featherweight title fight against Anthony Pettis at UFC 206, matching up with anyone on Earth, Conor's punching power, and his love of video games. Then, Anthony Pettis joins Jim and Matt to discuss fighting Max Holloway on December 10, the differences between Featherweight and Lightweight, his cars getting set on fire, and more.

item.title: UF48: Demetrious Johnson and Tim Elliott
item.description: Pound-For-Pound king and Flyweight champion Demetrious Johnson calls in ahead of his TUF 24 Finale title defense against Tim Elliott and discusses training for Tim's quirky style, Matt Hume as a trainer, and not caring about being overlooked by fans. Tim Elliott also calls in to talk about his experience in the TUF house, sparring with Dominick Cruz back in the day, and feeling like he's already won. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Jose Aldo, Khabib Nurmagomedov, Conor McGregor, Rumble turning down a Gegard Mousasi fight, and more.

item.title: UF45: Robert Whittaker, Derek Brunson, and Ray Longo
item.description: UFC Middleweight contender Robert Whittaker calls in to discuss his upcoming fight against Derek Brunson, moving towards a title shot, weight-cutting, TUF, and more. Later, Robert's opponent, Derek Brunson, calls in to talk about Robert as an opponent, his mentality in fights, his background in criminal justice, Conor vs. Eddie, and more. item.title: UF41: Eddie Alvarez and Chris Weidman
item.description: Lightweight champion Eddie Alvarez calls in after training to discuss his first title defense against Conor McGregor at UFC 205, why Conor is the easiest fight in the division, being mentally tough after years of fighting experience, Ferguson vs. dos Anjos, and more. Later, former UFC Middleweight champ Chris Weidman calls in to talk about his fight against Yoel Romero, getting to train at home during fight week, and the one thing he agrees with Michael Bisping about. Plus, Jim and Matt are reunited in studio to break down UFC Fight Night: Ferguson vs. dos Anjos, and another installment of Matt's Movie Minute.

item.title: UF38: Raquel Pennington and Corey Anderson
item.description: Jim and Matt take calls from UFC Women's Bantamweight contender Raquel Pennington and UFC Light Heavyweight contender Corey Anderson. First, Corey discusses his December 9 fight against Sean O'Connell, what it's like to work with Mark Henry, and learning the hard way about gassing out during college wrestling. Later, Raquel Pennington discusses her UFC 205 fight against former champion Miesha Tate, coming out as a lesbian and the importance of being true to yourself, drawing inspiration from fans, training in Colorado, and more. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss Urijah Faber's retirement plans, Cruz vs. Garbrandt at UFC 207, Jon Jones's potential return, and a lot more.

item.description: Middleweight contender Uriah Hall calls in to discuss his upcoming fight against Derek Brunson, bullying, the Adam Cella knockout from TUF 17, his cancelled bout versus Anderson Silva, and how he can definitely take Michael Bisping's belt. Plus, Jim and Matt discuss UFC Fight Night: Poirier vs. Johnson, the Luke Rockhold vs. Jacare Souza rematch in November, and Matt addresses some of Nick The Tooth's recent comments.

item.title: UF23: Stipe Miocic, Bill Engvall, and Ray Longo
item.description: Ray Longo joins Matt in studio this week to co-host the show as UFC Heavyweight champion Stipe Miocic calls in ahead of his first title defense versus Alistair Overeem in Cleveland. Later, Bill Engvall calls in to discuss his upcoming crime-thriller, The Neighbor, stand up comedy, and the evolution of MMA. Plus, Ray and Matt discuss Matt's win over GSP at UFC 69, the fallout from UFC Fight Night: Arlovski vs. Barnett, and much more.

item.title: UF22: Henry Cejudo and Joseph Benavidez
item.description: Henry Cejudo and Joseph Benavidez, the coaches for Season 24 of The Ultimate Fighter, both call in to talk about the new season with Jim and Matt. Henry discusses the Brandon Moreno situation, how TUF and the UFC have changed his life, and why he doesn't like Joe. Later, Joe discusses why Henry annoys him, his respect level for Dominick Cruz, PVZ's win over Bec Rawlings, and a lot more. Plus, Matt explains why he didn't make it to record last episode, his experience in the TUF house, and the guys break down UFC On Fox 21 and the Welterweight title picture.
